intro: Psychotria nymannii, commonly known as Nymann's psychotria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria nymannii is often found in association with other understory plants and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
